intro: Euphrasia lamii var. versteegii, commonly known as the Versteeg's beard-tongue, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers. The flowers are typically yellow or orange with distinctive dark markings, and they bloom during the spring and summer months. The plant has narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its rugged appearance. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats.
